title: Robust Multi-Agent Pickup and Delivery with Delays. (arXiv:2303.17422v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Multi-Agent Pickup and Delivery (MAPD) is the problem of computing collision-free paths for a group of agents such that they can safely reach delivery locations from pickup ones. These locations are provided at runtime, making MAPD a combination between classical Multi-Agent Path Finding (MAPF) and online task assignment. Current algorithms for MAPD do not consider many of the practical issues encountered in real applications: real agents often do not follow the planned paths perfectly, and may be subject to delays and failures. In this paper, we study the problem of MAPD with delays, and we present two solution approaches that provide robustness guarantees by planning paths that limit the effects of imperfect execution. In particular, we introduce two algorithms, k-TP and p-TP, both based on a decentralized algorithm typically used to solve MAPD, Token Passing (TP), which offer deterministic and probabilistic guarantees, respectively. Experimentally, we compare our algorithms against

Title: Robust Multi-Agent Pickup and Delivery with Delays. (arXiv:2303.17422v1 [cs.AI])
Abstract: Multi-Agent Pickup and Delivery (MAPD) is the problem of computing collision-free paths for a group of agents such that they can safely reach delivery locations from pickup ones. These locations are provided at runtime, making MAPD a combination between classical Multi-Agent Path Finding (MAPF) and online task assignment. In this paper, we study the problem of MAPD with delays, and we present two solution approaches that provide robustness guarantees by planning paths that limit the effects of imperfect execution. In particular, we introduce two algorithms, k-TP and p-TP, both based on a decentralized algorithm typically used to solve MAPD, Token Passing (TP), which offer deterministic and probabilistic guarantees, respectively. translated_title: 具有延迟的强鲁棒性多智能体接送问题
translated_abstract: 多智能体接送(MAPD)的问题在于计算一组代理的无碰撞路径，以便它们能够安全地从提取位置到达传递位置。这些位置在运行时提供，使得MAPD成为经典多智能体路径规划(MAPF)和在线任务分配的组合。目前的MAPD算法没有考虑到实际应用中遇到的许多实际问题：真实的代理通常不完全按计划路径行驶，可能会受到延迟和故障的影响。在本文中，我们研究了具有延迟的MAPD问题，并提出了两种解决方案，通过规划路径来限制不完美执行的效果，从而提供了鲁棒性保证。具体来说，我们引入了两种算法，k-TP和p-TP，都基于分布式算法Token Passing(TP)，它通常用于解决MAPD，分别提供确定性和概率保证。在实验上，我们将我们的算法与现有的算法进行比较。
tldr: 研究了具有实际应用中常见的不完美执行的多智能体接送问题，并提出了两种通过规划路径来限制不完美执行效果的解决方案，提供了鲁棒性保证。
en_tdlr: This paper studies the problem of Multi-Agent Pickup and Delivery (MAPD) with delays, and proposes two solution approaches that provide robustness guarantees by planning paths that limit the effects of imperfect execution.
